alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 4:27PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 515 PM MDT... At 427 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Crystal Lake Campground to South Greeley. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Federal, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 5 and 26. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 346 and 370. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
